Anego den (Japan) (short title) 
Elder Sister: OchÃƒÂ´ Inoshika (International: English title) (literal title) 
OchÃƒÂ´ (Japan) (short title) 
Sex and Fury (International: English title)


The creator of any exploitation film should be very pleased when his production is described as being repulsive, disgusting or amoral. But one word that should not be used to describe this kind of movie is &#039;dull.&#039; Unfortunately, that&#039;s how I describe this movie. The film does have plenty of sex and violence but it is also very talky and sluggish. Overall, it lacks the panache that I come to expect from this kind of production. The film has very few surprises. I&#039;ve seen same scenario done in a much more imaginative manner. I do have to say that there is a priceless moment where the bare-naked heroine slaughters a group of assassins. That scene alone is worth the rental fee. But that&#039;s not nearly enough to make it enjoyable. Fans of Quentin Tarantino&#039;s "Kill Bill" saga should know that he did steal at least one sequence from this movie. But you have to sit through a lot of nonsense before you get to that sequence. Cult figure Christina Lindberg ("Thriller, A Cruel Film") has a key supporting role. Only for very curious viewers who need to see everything.
